thread.title: Anti-racist and anti-fascist demo planned outside UKIP annual conference in Torquay

author: Caroline Abbott
title: Anti-racist and anti-fascist demo planned outside UKIP annual conference in Torquay
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Comments 
Anti-racist and anti-fascist groups are planning to demonstrate today outside the UKIP annual conference in Torquay. 
They are protesting against Dr Hugh Bronson, a British-German representative of the nationalist, anti-Islam Alternative for Germany party. 
He has been invited to take to the stage this afternoon to address UKIP members at the conference. 
UKIP’s interim leader Steve Crowther congratulated AfD after it came third in the German election. 
UKIP will unveil its fourth new leader in the space of one year shortly after 5pm today, and the announcement could trigger the party’s collapse. 
Politicians and staff have threatened to quit if far-right, anti-Islam Anne Marie Waters, who is the bookies’ favourite, wins the leadership contest. 
Former UKIP leader Nigel Farage is not expected to turn up for the result at the EU-funded Riviera International Conference Centre in Torquay . 
He has warned UKIP will be ‘finished’ if Ms Waters wins but has been forced to deny claims he would set up a new breakaway party. Nigel Farage 
With around 15,000 members voting, any one of six of the seven candidates could win: Anne Marie Waters, Peter Whittle, David Kurten, John Rees Evans, Jane Collins and Henry Bolton. The seventh candidate, Aidan Powlesland, wants to spend £1billion on mining the asteroid belt and moons of Jupiter and Saturn within the next decade and is not seen as having a chance. 
In the 2015 general election, UKIP was the UK’s third-biggest party by vote share. It is still searching for a new focus after the vote for Brexit. Read More Ukip leader says defectors who jumped ship to Devon Tories have ‘badly miscalculated’ 
During the conference, members will vote on a rebrand which is expected to see the party drop its yellow and purple colours in a bid to bring it back to life. 
Dr Hugh Bronson, a British-German representative of the nationalist, anti-Islam Alternative for Germany party, has been invited to take to the stage this afternoon to address the hundreds of UKIP members at the conference. UKIP’s interim leader Steve Crowther congratulated AfD after it came third in the German election. Read More 
Various anti-racist and anti-fascist organisations are planning to demonstrate against this throughout the next two days but particularly early this afternoon. 
The UKIP conference opened this morning with a welcome from UKIP member Julien Parrott, a Torbay councillor . 
The conference continues tomorrow, drawing to a close at 5pm. Like us on Facebook
